      • getServices

        public <T> Collection<T> getServices(Class<T> serviceInterface)
        Returns with a unmodifiable collection of services that are registered to the application context and is assignable from the specified service interface.
        Parameters:
        serviceInterface - the service interface.
        Returns:
        a collection of registered services.

      • getServiceChecked

        public <T> T getServiceChecked(Class<T> serviceInterface)
        Returns with the service instance associated with the passed in service interface. May throw runtime exception if the service associated with the passed in interface is not registered or null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the service.
        Parameters:
        serviceInterface - the interface of the required service. Should not be null.
        Returns:
        the available registered service instance.

      • unregisterService

        public <T> void unregisterService(Class<T> serviceInterface)
        Unregisters a service give its service interface from the application context. The associated service change listeners will not be removed.
        Parameters:
        serviceInterface - the service interface to unregister.

      • exists

        public <T> boolean exists(Class<T> serviceInterface)
        Returns true if a the service given with it interface is registered to the application context with an implementation that can be referenced by clients. Otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        serviceInterface -

                                   IServiceChangeListener<T> listener)

      • checkStrictServices

        public Collection<ApplicationContext.ServiceRegistryEntry<?>> checkStrictServices()
        Checks the availability of the registered services strictly, which means that null implementations are not acceptable.
        Returns:
        the set of ApplicationContext.ServiceRegistryEntrys which are currently does not have implementation classes registered.

      • removeServiceListener

        public <T> void removeServiceListener(Class<T> serviceInterface,
                                      IServiceChangeListener<T> listener)

      • dispose

        public void dispose()

      • isServerMode

        public boolean isServerMode()
        Returns true if the application for the current application context is running in server mode. Otherwise, returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the application is running in server mode, otherwise false.
